content.raw:
It appears to fail when attempting to insert a second drc_robot when the vrc_plugin is loaded.
~~~
Error [MultiSenseSLPlugin.cpp:81] spindle link not found, plugin will stop loading
Error [SensorManager.cc:201] Unable to get a sensor, multiple sensors with the same name[r_foot_contact_sensor]. Use a scoped name instead, world_name::model_name::link_name::sensor_name.
Error [DRCRobotPlugin.cc:134] r_foot_contact_sensor not found

Error [SensorManager.cc:201] Unable to get a sensor, multiple sensors with the same name[l_foot_contact_sensor]. Use a scoped name instead, world_name::model_name::link_name::sensor_name.
Error [DRCRobotPlugin.cc:140] l_foot_contact_sensor not found
~~~

It appears to fail when attempting to insert a second drc_robot when the vrc_plugin is loaded.

Error [SensorManager.cc:201] Unable to get a sensor, multiple sensors with the same name[l_foot_contact_sensor]. Use a scoped name instead, world_name::model_name::link_name::sensor_name.
Error [DRCRobotPlugin.cc:140] l_foot_contact_sensor not found

pullrequest.title: adding/moving multi-model interactions into vrc plugin

content.raw:
The drc_vehicle now has a key switch, direction switch and handbrake in addition to steering wheel, and gas and brake pedals. To see the state of these elements, echo the corresponding ros topics:
~~~
rostopic echo /golf_cart/key/state
rostopic echo /golf_cart/direction/state
rostopic echo /golf_cart/hand_brake/state
~~~

* Hand brake: 0 is disengaged, 1 is engaged.
* Key: 0 is OFF, 1 is ON, -1 is ON_FR (see KeyState enum)
* Direction: 0 is NEUTRAL, 1 is FORWARD, -1 is REVERSE (see DirectionState enum)

The vehicle currently starts with key ON and direction FORWARD and handbrake engaged. To start driving in a circle to the right, disengage the hand brake:
~~~
rostopic pub --once /golf_cart/hand_brake/cmd std_msgs/Float64 0
~~~
crank the steering wheel to -7 radians
~~~
rostopic pub --once /golf_cart/hand_wheel/cmd std_msgs/Float64 -- -7
~~~
and then stomp on the gas pedal
~~~
rostopic pub --once /golf_cart/gas_pedal/cmd std_msgs/Float64 1
~~~
To reverse directions:
~~~
rostopic pub --once /golf_cart/direction/cmd std_msgs/Int8 -- -1
~~~
content.html:
The drc_vehicle now has a key switch, direction switch and handbrake in addition to steering wheel, and gas and brake pedals. To see the state of these elements, echo the corresponding ros topics:

rostopic echo /golf_cart/key/state
rostopic echo /golf_cart/direction/state
rostopic echo /golf_cart/hand_brake/state
  • Hand brake: 0 is disengaged, 1 is engaged.
  • Key: 0 is OFF, 1 is ON, -1 is ON_FR (see KeyState enum)
  • Direction: 0 is NEUTRAL, 1 is FORWARD, -1 is REVERSE (see DirectionState enum)

The vehicle currently starts with key ON and direction FORWARD and handbrake engaged. To start driving in a circle to the right, disengage the hand brake:

rostopic pub --once /golf_cart/hand_brake/cmd std_msgs/Float64 0

crank the steering wheel to -7 radians

rostopic pub --once /golf_cart/hand_wheel/cmd std_msgs/Float64 -- -7

and then stomp on the gas pedal

rostopic pub --once /golf_cart/gas_pedal/cmd std_msgs/Float64 1

To reverse directions:

rostopic pub --once /golf_cart/direction/cmd std_msgs/Int8 -- -1

update.description:
no-op merge from default due to merging of pull request #61

refactored vehicle plugin

clean up some camel_case issues

added delayed ros initialization in plugins

enlarged golf cart so robot can fit in it

Added hand brake, key switch, and forward/neutral/reverse direction switch to DRCVehicle, with corresponding ros topics

pull_request.title: adding/moving multi-model interactions into vrc plugin

pullrequest.title: adding/moving multi-model interactions into vrc plugin

content.raw:
This plugin exposes topics for entering and exiting the vehicle:
~~~
/drc_world/robot_enter_car
/drc_world/robot_exit_car
~~~
These topics take a pose message. Sending an identify pose to robot_enter_car will put the robot in the driver's seat:
~~~
rostopic pub --once /drc_world/robot_enter_car geometry_msgs/Pose '{position: {x: 0, y: 0, z: 0}, orientation: {w: 1, x: 0, y: 0, z: 0}}'
~~~
You can also put the robot in the passenger's seat by specifying an offset in the pose:
~~~
rostopic pub --once /drc_world/robot_enter_car geometry_msgs/Pose '{position: {x: 0, y: -1, z: 0}, orientation: {w: 1, x: 0, y: 0, z: 0}}'
~~~
Giving an identity pose to robot_exit_car will cause an exit to the default position on the driver's side door:
~~~
rostopic pub --once /drc_world/robot_exit_car geometry_msgs/Pose '{position: {x: 0, y: 0, z: 0}, orientation: {w: 1, x: 0, y: 0, z: 0}}'
~~~
You can also put the robot outside the passenger's side door, facing the car:
~~~
rostopic pub --once /drc_world/robot_exit_car geometry_msgs/Pose '{position: {x: 0, y: -3.5, z: 0}, orientation: {w: 0.707, x: 0, y: 0, z: 0.707}}'
~~~
Just be careful not to specify a quaternion with all zero elements, as that is not a valid quaternion and seems to cause problems.
content.html:
This plugin exposes topics for entering and exiting the vehicle:

/drc_world/robot_enter_car
/drc_world/robot_exit_car

These topics take a pose message. Sending an identify pose to robot_enter_car will put the robot in the driver's seat:

rostopic pub --once /drc_world/robot_enter_car geometry_msgs/Pose '{position: {x: 0, y: 0, z: 0}, orientation: {w: 1, x: 0, y: 0, z: 0}}'

You can also put the robot in the passenger's seat by specifying an offset in the pose:

rostopic pub --once /drc_world/robot_enter_car geometry_msgs/Pose '{position: {x: 0, y: -1, z: 0}, orientation: {w: 1, x: 0, y: 0, z: 0}}'

Giving an identity pose to robot_exit_car will cause an exit to the default position on the driver's side door:

rostopic pub --once /drc_world/robot_exit_car geometry_msgs/Pose '{position: {x: 0, y: 0, z: 0}, orientation: {w: 1, x: 0, y: 0, z: 0}}'

You can also put the robot outside the passenger's side door, facing the car:

rostopic pub --once /drc_world/robot_exit_car geometry_msgs/Pose '{position: {x: 0, y: -3.5, z: 0}, orientation: {w: 0.707, x: 0, y: 0, z: 0.707}}'

Just be careful not to specify a quaternion with all zero elements, as that is not a valid quaternion and seems to cause problems.
